requirements.summary: Make the horizontal timeline instantly understandable as horizontally scrollable and improve date readability while keeping the section compact and romantic.
acceptanceCriteria: Timeline clearly communicates horizontal navigation via at least two visual affordances (e.g., subtle left/right edge fades, an inline hint text like “Scroll to explore →”, visible drag/scroll indicator, or arrow controls).
Each timeline card’s date is visually distinct (font weight/size/contrast) and remains easy to scan on mobile and desktop.
No user-facing text added for guidance uses non-English language (all guidance/hints must be English).
Horizontal timeline remains shorter than an equivalent vertical list and does not introduce long vertical scrolling.

file_operations.description: Update the Timeline section UI to clearly signal horizontal scrolling using multiple affordances: add subtle left/right edge fade overlays, add an English inline hint (e.g., “Scroll to explore →”) placed above/within the timeline container, and ensure the hint is non-intrusive (can fade out after first interaction). Improve date styling (more prominent weight/size/contrast, tabular numerals) without changing any event strings, ordering, or reveal animation behavior; keep the overall section height compact and romantic (no blue/purple tones).

Add small reusable utilities for the Timeline section presentation (e.g., a no-scrollbar utility for horizontal scrollers, and/or subtle mask/fade helpers) using the existing warm palette and avoiding blue/purple tones. Ensure utilities support compact layout and do not alter event content.

requirements.summary: Add optional navigation helpers (snap-to-card and/or left-right controls) so browsing timeline items feels smooth on desktop and mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can reliably move through timeline items without precision scrolling on both trackpad/mouse and touch (mobile).
If snap behavior is implemented, the scroll position settles cleanly on a card boundary (no awkward half-visible cards after interaction).
Any added controls do not overlap timeline content and remain accessible on small screens.

file_operations.description: Create a small hook to support horizontal timeline navigation helpers (e.g., container ref wiring, canScrollLeft/canScrollRight state, and functions to scroll one card at a time and/or to the nearest snap point). Use this hook from the Timeline section to keep logic isolated.

Implement optional navigation helpers for the horizontal timeline: enable clean snap-to-card behavior (scroll-snap) and add left/right controls that scroll by one card increment without overlapping content (positioned outside/above the scroller on small screens as needed). Ensure controls are accessible (keyboard/focus states, aria-labels) and work well with mouse/trackpad and touch.

requirements.summary: Polish Timeline visuals to feel cleaner and more premium while preserving existing events, card layout, and reveal animation style.
acceptanceCriteria: All existing timeline events (date, title, 1-line description) remain unchanged and in the same order as currently implemented.

Existing entrance/reveal animation behavior remains (items animate in as they come into view), but the overall timeline looks more cohesive (spacing, alignment, and decorative line/dots feel intentional).
Design continues to avoid blue/purple tones for timeline UI elements.

file_operations.description: Refine Timeline visuals for a premium, cohesive look: tune spacing, alignment, shadows, borders, and decorative line/dot treatment while keeping the same card structure and the existing in-view reveal animation. Maintain the warm romantic palette (no blue/purple), and keep all milestone content and ordering exactly as-is.

Adjust/add any minimal global animation or typography utilities needed to support the refined Timeline presentation (e.g., subtle shadow/outline consistency or motion-reduce fallbacks) while preserving the existing reveal animation style and avoiding blue/purple tones.
